segments.text: Kevin O'Leary, otherwise known as mister Wonderful, is working to develop the world's largest AI data center. It's at an industrial park in Alberta, Canada. Kevin O'Leary joins me now. Alright, Kevin. I got 2 questions.
1st, why Canada? And second, where are you gonna get to all the juice, the electricity, for this big data center?

Well, you know, this started, I can give you a little credit to you there, Stuart. You had Danielle Smith on your show recently within the last couple of weeks. She has permits. She has power. She's got the right climate.
And I flew up there to meet with her, and she said, look. I can get you the permits on over 5,000 acres of land. You can buy that land. You can start building. And my answer was yes, ma'am.

That's exactly what I did because the demand for AI data centers this will be the largest over over 7 gigs of data center. The world needs 30 gigs right now. We're only building 4 stateside. This is all about permits and power, Stuart.
And she's got them, and I'm there. I'm ready to go to work.

I would have thought that the only way to supply massive amounts of power to these massive data centers on a short term basis is to go nuclear. Is that is that that's the way to do it is, like, ideally.

Yes. But you said short term. Westinghouse is the most advanced on the small nuclear solutions, 12 to 15 years. But here's the problem, Stuart, pricing right now at 58 to 61,000,000,000 per gigawatt. Now the way to think about a gigawatt is you can light up a 1000000 homes with that, but that's now what the smallest data center requirements are.

So what, Smith has, premier Smith, is she's got 200 trillion cubic square feet of natural gas. We can put turbines there and convert it on a clean basis into electricity, and that's what's going to be the interim solution over the next 20 years. And so we've have other opportunities as well with this nat gas. One would be in West Virginia and the other in North Dakota, but I need permits.
Trump promises permits and environmental approvals for those investing $1,000,000,000 in America. What does Kevin O'Leary think about that?
Yeah. I'll bring $1,000,000,000 to both those states. Give me the permits. Gotta have the permits.
Obviously, you approve of that. It's a good way to attract capital. Right?

Well, it's doing it right now as we speak. Are you kidding? If he can deliver on that and he's got Bergam as the energy czar who knows North Dakota inside out, And, of course, West Virginia has got lots of gas. Yeah. This is the this is what I'm talking about.
